title: Mauricio Pochettino admits Tottenham's Amazon documentary is 'another thing to worry about'
text:

Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino has admitted being filmed for an Amazon documentary is adding extra stress to the job.

It was announced on Friday that Spurs will be the subject of the latest series of fly-on-the-wall documentary All or Nothing - with Pochettino saying he now feels like "a producer" as well as a manager.

The series will focus on the current campaign, with Tottenham having endured a difficult start.

Speculation over Pochettino's future - as well as around key players such as Christian Eriksen - has added to the pressure on the Spurs camp amid a run of indifferent results.

Tottenham looked back to their best as they thrashed Red Star Belgrade 5-0 in the Champions League on Tuesday, and will hope they can put a dent in Liverpool's title ambitions in their Premier League clash at Anfield on Sunday.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

And Spurs boss Pochettino says the Amazon documentary had added another level of stress going into the game.

"Of course, when the club agreed the deal with Amazon, of course we were worried about it," he said.

"Because it is not easy, it is not easy. You say it is tough to have the camera in your office.

"Then how you handle the situation to have the capacity to say, 'okay, I am not in a good mood', but sometimes the camera is going to be there.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

"It is so complicated, it is another thing to worry about and of course that adds a lot.

"If we were busy now we are super busy. To plan everyday, everything is not an easy job.

"That is why, when I told you I feel that I am not any more a manager, I am a coach, now I am like a producer. Being coach, manager and producer."
description: Spurs boss says he feels 'more like a producer' than just a manager while camera crews film behind the scenes
